manifest.title: BookStack
manifest.author: BookStack authors
manifest.description:
## About

BookStack is an opinionated wiki system that provides a pleasant and simple out
of the box experience. New users to an instance should find the experience intuitive
and only basic word-processing skills should be required to get involved in creating
content on BookStack. The platform should provide advanced power features to those that desire it, but they should not interfere with the core simple user experience.

BookStack is not designed as an extensible platform to be used for purposes that differ to the statement above.

In regard to development philosophy, BookStack has a relaxed, open & positive approach. We aim to slowly yet continuously evolve the platform while providing a stable & easy upgrade path.

## Feature

* Free & Open Source
* Easy, Simple Interface
* Configurable
* Multi-lingual
* Integrated Authentication
manifest.changelog:
* Update BookStack to 25.12.3
* [Full Changelog](https://github.com/BookStackApp/BookStack/releases/tag/v25.12.3)
* Page Content - As of this release, most types of form content are now removed from page content on render. If you applied customizations which made use of in-page form content, you may now need to find alternative methods.
* Updated application PHP dependencies.
* Updated session-based API authentication to only be active for GET requests.
* Updated page content filtering to remove many common form elements & attributes.
* Updated translations with latest Crowdin changes. ([#5997](https://github.com/BookStackApp/BookStack/pull/5997))
manifest.postInstallMessage:
This app is pre-setup with an admin account. The initial credentials are: **Username**: admin@admin.com
**Password**: password

change-default-user-role.message: This app is pre-setup to give admin status to all users. Change this by going to `Settings` -> `Registration` and adjusting the value of `Default user role after registration`
